resources.string:
- Avoid exposed wires, outlets, and electronic devices near fire 

 - Attempt to shut off electricity if safe to do so 

 - If fire is small on manageable, use a fire extinguisher to put out - Don't use water on Electrical Fire

- Turn off heat source - Don't use water on Oil Fire 

 - Attempt to put out with flame retardant blanket or other source to remove oxygen 

 - If you can't cover the flame, pour A LOT of baking soda on it

- Remove any jewelry and restrictive clothing 

 - Clean the area with soap and water 

 - Cover area with an adhesive bandage or gauze

- If bleeding, apply pressure to restrict flow of blood 

 - Clean wound with anti-bacterial soap or disinfectant 

 - Cover area with an adhesive bandage or gauze

- Cool burned area with cold water until pain lessens 

 - Cover with a dry, sterile bandage or clean dressing 

 - Do NOT touch area

- Stay Calm 

 - Stay Still and Hidden 

 - Assure your safety and the safety of others 

 - Don't engage or aggrivate the assailant before police arrive

- Remember features or characteristics of assailant to report to police 

 - Do NOT pursuit the assailant 

 - Do NOT try to fight the assailant unless absolutely necessary
